riddle: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
I'm light as a feather, yet the strongest person can't hold me for much longer than a minute. What am I?
What has a key but can’t open locks?
I am a seven-letter word. I am very heavy. Take away two letters, and you'll get eight. What am I?
In days of old, I was revered. A symbol of power, greatly feared. Carved from stone with eyes that gleam. Guarding treasures in my ancient scheme. What am I?
I am taken from a mine, and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost every person. What am I?
I am not alive, but I can grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?

pun: Why did the JavaScript developer go broke?
answer: Because he used up all his 'cache!'

pun: Why did the JavaScript function break up with its partner?
answer: Because they had too many 'arguments' and couldn't 'resolve'their issues!

pun: Why did the server go to therapy?
answer: Because it had too many 'clients' and needed to 'process' its feelings!

pun: Why did the CSS file break up with the HTML file?
answer: Because it felt like it was being 'styled' too much and needed some 'space' to 'float' freely!

pun: Why did the CSS file go to jail?

mchoice: Which of the following programming languages was named after a comedy television show?
answer: A) Python, B) Ruby - Named after a sketch in “Monty Python’s Flying Circus, C) Java, D) Lisp

mchoice: Which of the following is not a valid HTML tag?
Which of the following is not a valid CSS property for styling text?
answer: A) font-family, B) text-color, C) font-size, D) text-decoration

mchoice: In J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth legendarium, which creature did Gandalf face in the Mines of Moria?
answer: A) Balrog, B) Orc, C) Troll, D) Dragon
